benchmark_details.name: Shona–English Slang Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: This work introduces a novel Shona–English slang dataset curated from anonymized social media conversations, annotated for intent, sentiment, dialogue acts, code-mixing, and tone, to advance NLP resources for African languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance NLP for low-resource African languages, fostering digital inclusion and culturally resonant conversational AI.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset’s small size limits coverage, particularly for finance-related intents.

data.source: Curated from anonymized social media conversations
data.annotation: Manually annotated for intent, sentiment, dialogue acts, code-mixing, and tone.

methodology.calculation: Calculated during training and evaluation based on validation loss.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and F1 scores indicate better model performance on intent classification.
methodology.validation: Validation set created using an 80/20 split from the dataset.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data anonymization procedures discussed to ensure participant confidentiality.
